contentBlocks.title: Requirements
items: An air-conditioning system must be capable of being deactivated when the building or part of a building served by that system is not occupied
When serving more than one air-conditioning zone or area with different heating or cooling needs, must thermostatically control the temperature of each zone or area
Must not control the temperature by mixing actively heated air and actively cooled air
Must limit reheating to not more than 7.5 K rise in temperature for fixed supply air rate

Must limit reheating to not more than 7.5 K rise in temperature at the nominal supply air rate but increased or decreased at the same rate that the supply air rate is respectively decreased or increased for variable supply air rate
Which contains more than one water heater, chiller or coil, must be capable of stopping the flow of water to those not operating
With an airflow of more than 1000 L/s, must have a variable speed fan when its supply air quantity is capable of being varied
Must have the ability to use direct signals from the control components responsible for the delivery of comfort conditions in the building to regulate the operation of central plant
Must have a control dead band of not less than 2°C, except where a smaller range is required for specialised applications
Must be provided with balancing dampers and balancing valves, as required to meet the needs of the system at its maximum operating condition
Must have automatic variable temperature operation of heated water and chilled water circuits
When deactivated, must close any motorised outdoor air or return air damper that is not otherwise being actively controlled

contentBlocks.title: Mechanical Ventilation Requirements
contentBlocks.text: An air-conditioning system which provides the required mechanical ventilation, other than where dehumidification control is needed, must have an outdoor air economy cycle if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to the flow rates specified for the respective climate zone.

contentBlocks.title: Multiple Systems Control
items: When two or more air-conditioning systems serve the same space they must use control sequences that prevent the systems from operating in opposing heating and cooling modes

contentBlocks.title: Time Switches Requirements
items: A time switch must be provided to control an air-conditioning system of more than 2 kWr
A time switch must be provided to control a heater of more than 1 kW used for air-conditioning heating
The time switch must be capable of switching electric power on and off at variable pre-programmed times and on variable pre-programmed days

contentBlocks.title: Time Switch Exemptions - Class 4 Buildings
items: An air-conditioning system that serves a Class 4 part of a building

contentBlocks.title: Time Switch Exemptions - Other Buildings
items: An air-conditioning system that serves only one sole-occupancy unit in a Class 2, 3 or 9c building
A conditioned space where air-conditioning is needed for 24 hour continuous use

contentBlocks.title: Class 3 Building Balcony Requirements
contentBlocks.text: When serving a sole-occupancy unit in a Class 3 building, the air-conditioning system must not operate when any external door of the sole-occupancy unit that opens to a balcony or the like, is open for more than one minute.

contentBlocks.title: Large Space Requirements
contentBlocks.text: Must ensure that each independently operating space of more than 1 000 m² and every separate floor of the building has provision to terminate airflow independently.

contentBlocks.title: Climate Zone 2 Requirements
contentBlocks.text: For Climate Zone 2, an outdoor air economy cycle is required if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to 9000 L/s.

contentBlocks.title: Climate Zone 3 Requirements
contentBlocks.text: For Climate Zone 3, an outdoor air economy cycle is required if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to 7500 L/s.

contentBlocks.title: Climate Zone 4 Requirements
contentBlocks.text: For Climate Zone 4, an outdoor air economy cycle is required if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to 3500 L/s.

contentBlocks.title: Climate Zone 5 Requirements
contentBlocks.text: For Climate Zone 5, an outdoor air economy cycle is required if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to 3000 L/s.

contentBlocks.title: Climate Zone 6 Requirements
contentBlocks.text: For Climate Zone 6, an outdoor air economy cycle is required if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to 2000 L/s.

contentBlocks.title: Climate Zone 7 Requirements
contentBlocks.text: For Climate Zone 7, an outdoor air economy cycle is required if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to 2500 L/s.

contentBlocks.title: Climate Zone 8 Requirements
contentBlocks.text: For Climate Zone 8, an outdoor air economy cycle is required if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to 4000 L/s.
